com.minecolonies.configgui.title: MineColonies Config
minecolonies.config.gameplay.comment: All configuration items related to the core gameplay
minecolonies.config.claims.comment: All configuration related to colony claims
minecolonies.config.combat.comment: All configuration items related to the combat elements of MineColonies
minecolonies.config.compatibility.commen: All configuration related to mod compatibility
minecolonies.config.requestsystem.commen: All configurations related to the request system
minecolonies.config.commands.comment: All configurations related to the MineColonies commands
minecolonies.config.research.comment: All configurations related to the research system
minecolonies.config.neighborbuildingrend: By default, when placing a schematic near other buildings, the already-placed buildings will show as if they were at level 5 and have a blue outline around them. You can disable that by setting this to false.
minecolonies.config.neighborbuildingrang: How close a building needs to be to another to be considered a neighbor, in blocks. -1 = intersecting, 0 = touching
minecolonies.config.buildgogglerange.com: How close (in blocks) you need to be to see work orders while wearing the Build Goggles.
minecolonies.config.colonyteamborders: Show Colony Borders in Team Colors
minecolonies.config.colonyteamborders.co: When true, the colony borders shown when holding the build tool will be in the colony's team color. When false, the colony you're inside will be white and any other colony will be red.
minecolonies.config.diseasemodifier.comm: How common diseases are. 1 = Very common, 100 = extremely rare.
minecolonies.config.diseases.comment: All diseases citizens can get. The name, how common it is, and all ingredients to cure it.
minecolonies.config.configliststudyitems: Items consumed by citizens in the Library.
minecolonies.config.generatesupplyloot.c: Whether to generate supply ships and camps in loot chests.
minecolonies.config.forceloadcolony.comm: If part of the colony is loaded by an owner/officer, should the colony be kept loaded? (Set how many chunks are loaded with the "Colony Chunk Loading Strictness" option.)
minecolonies.config.loadtime.comment: Set how long chunks stay loaded after player leaves, does not persist through restarts. Default: 10min
minecolonies.config.colonyloadstrictness: This controls how many chunks are loaded with the "Chunk Load Colony" option. The higher this value, the fewer chunks will be loaded. (The innermost chunks will be loaded first.) 1 = load all claimed chunks.
minecolonies.config.badvisitorchance.com: Chance to get an evil Tavern visitor that will run off with the resources you give them. This is a %.
minecolonies.config.researchcreativecomp: Allows automatic and (near) instant completion of research for players in creative mode. If false, creative players will still be able to begin researches, but will have normal progress rates.
minecolonies.config.researchdebuglog.com: Significantly increases the amount of information related to research datapacks that is logged during the world load.
minecolonies.config.researchresetcost: Cost to Undo a Completed Research
minecolonies.config.researchresetcost.co: A list of items to charge players when undoing an already-completed research.
minecolonies.config.listofplantables.com: The items and item-tags that the Florist can plant.
item.minecolonies.scepterlumberjack.used: Position A set. Select Position B with a right-click or discard tool when finished.
Position B set. Select Position A with a left-click or discard tool when finished.
item.minecolonies.scepterlumberjack.rest: A zone of %d blocks is too large. The maximum restricted volume for the Forester is %d blocks.
Forester restricted zone set (x: %d to %d, y: %d to %d, z: %d to %d, total: %d blocks). The max size is %d blocks.
minecolonies.config.maxtreesize.comment: Max log count in one tree for the Forester to check during their tree search.
minecolonies.config.nosupplyplacementres: Disables supply camp placing restrictions, intended for skyworlds and similar
minecolonies.config.skyraiders: Enable raiders to spawn in the sky
minecolonies.config.skyraiders.comment: Raiders will spawn in the sky if this is enabled
minecolonies.config.disableemptycolonies: Will stop empty colonies from being generated in the world - Needs world Reload
minecolonies.config.averageemptycolonydi: Average Empty Colony Distance - Needs Complete Restart
Average distance in chunks between 2 empty colonies
minecolonies.config.builderplaceconstruc: Should construction tape be placed around in-construction builds?
minecolonies.config.allowinfinitesupplyc: Should players be able to place an infinite amount of supply camps/ships?
minecolonies.config.allowinfinitecolonie: Should players be allowed to abandon their colony to create a new one easily? Note: This is buggy!
minecolonies.config.allowotherdimcolonie: Should colonies in other dimensions be allowed?
minecolonies.config.citizenrespawninterv: If a colony is under the initial citizen count, this changes the amount of time before a new citizen spawns.
minecolonies.config.builderbuildblockdel: Delay after each block placement (increasing it increases the delay).
minecolonies.config.blockminingdelaymodi: Delay modifier to mine a block (decreasing it decreases the delay).
minecolonies.config.enableindevelopmentf: Should development features be enabled (might be buggy)?
Should citizen name tags be rendered?
minecolonies.config.workersalwaysworkinr: Should workers work during the rain?
minecolonies.config.sendenteringleavingm: Should players be sent entering/leaving colony notifications?
minecolonies.config.allowglobalnamechang: Should players be allowed to change citizen names? -1 for false, 0 for certain players only, 1 for true. (To set which players can change the names, see "Special Permissions Group" below.)
minecolonies.config.holidayfeatures.comm: Should special holiday content be displayed?
minecolonies.config.updaterate.comment: AI Update rate. Increase this to improve performance. This throttles citizen updates.
minecolonies.config.dirtfromcompost.comm: Quantity of dirt per compost filling.
minecolonies.config.luckyblockchance.com: Chance for the Miner to get an ore when mining cobblestone or stone (by default, can be expanded with datapacks to other materials). This is a percentage. (To change which ores the Miner can find, see "List of Lucky Ores".)
minecolonies.config.minthleveltoteleport: The minimum level a Town Hall has to be to allow teleportation to allied colonies.
minecolonies.config.suggestbuildtoolplac: Suggest build tool usage when trying to place a building without the build tool.
minecolonies.config.canplayerusertpcomma: Can Players Use the RTP Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc rtp command?
minecolonies.config.canplayerusecolonytp: Can Players Use the Colony TP Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc colony teleport command?
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseallytown: Can players teleport to allied colonies?
minecolonies.config.canplayerusehometpco: Can Players Use the Home TP Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc home command? Note: Only owners of the colony can use this command.
minecolonies.config.canplayerusecitizeni: Can Players Use the Citizen Info Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc citizens info command?
minecolonies.config.canplayeruselistciti: Can Players Use the List Citizens Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc citizens list command?
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseshowcolo: Can Players Use the Show Colony Info Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc colony info command?
minecolonies.config.canplayerusekillciti: Can Players Use the Kill Citizens Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc citizens kill command?
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseaddoffic: Can Players Use the Add Officer Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc colony addOfficer command?
minecolonies.config.canplayerusedeleteco: Can Players Use the Delete Colony Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc colony delete command?
minecolonies.config.numberofattemptsfors: Number of Attempts for Safe TP
Amount of attempts to find a safe random teleport (with /mc rtp).
minecolonies.config.maxcolonysize.commen: Maximum claim range for a colony. This is the radius, measured in chunks.
minecolonies.config.mincolonydistance.co: The minimum distance (in chunks) between colonies.
minecolonies.config.initialcolonysize.co: Initial claim size for a colony. This is the radius, measured in chunks.
minecolonies.config.restrictcolonyplacem: Should the min/max distance from spawn also affect colony placement?
minecolonies.config.enabledynamiccolonys: Should colonies have a fixed radius or should it be dynamic?
minecolonies.config.maxdistancefromworld: Max distance (in blocks) from world spawn for a colony.
minecolonies.config.mindistancefromworld: Min distance (in blocks) from world spawn for a colony.
minecolonies.config.officersreceiveadvan: Should officers of a colony receive advancements from that colony?
minecolonies.config.enablecolonyraids.co: Whether or not to spawn raiders.
minecolonies.config.maxRaiders.comment: The maximum amount of raiders spawned per raid
minecolonies.config.raidersbreakblocks.c: Whether or not raiders are able to break through blocks
minecolonies.config.raidersbreakdoors.co: Whether or not raiders can break through doors.
minecolonies.config.averagenumberofnight: Average Number of Nights Between Raids
The average number of nights between raids.
minecolonies.config.minimumnumberofnight: Minimum Number of Nights Between Raids
The minimum number of nights between raids.
minecolonies.config.citizencallforhelp.c: Should citizens call Guards for help when attacked?
minecolonies.config.pvp_mode.comment: Turn on MineColonies PVP mode (colonies can be destroyed and griefed under certain conditions).
minecolonies.config.daysuntilpirateships: Days until the pirate ships despawn.
minecolonies.config.maxyforbarbarians.co: Max Y level (height) for Raiders to spawn.
minecolonies.config.maxkeptbackups.comme: Set the max amount of backups kept
minecolonies.config.turnoffexplosionsinc: Independent from the colony protection, should explosions be turned off inside colonies? DAMAGE_NOTHING prevents explosions completely. DAMAGE_PLAYERS, allows explosions to damage players and hostile mobs, but not blocks or neutral or friendly mobs. DAMAGE_ENTITIES allows damage to all entities. DAMAGE_EVERYTHING allows explosions to damage entities and blocks.
minecolonies.config.specialpermgroup.com: Players who have special permissions, especially to change citizen names (see "Name Changes" above).
minecolonies.config.freetointeractblocks: Blocks players should be able to interact with in any colony (ex: vending machines)
minecolonies.config.secondsbetweenpermis: Seconds between each permission message (to reduce spam).
minecolonies.config.dynamictreeharvestsi: Forester harvest trunk size for dynamic trees: 1-8.
minecolonies.config.siftermeshes.comment: List of materials a sifter can use as a mesh material, along with bonus weights
minecolonies.config.siftableblocks.comme: List of materials a Sifter can rifle through for resources.
minecolonies.config.sifterdrops.comment: List of materials a sifter can find from raw materials, as well as their weights.
minecolonies.config.crusherproduction.co: List of materials a Crusher can reduce and what they convert into, separated by exclamation marks.
minecolonies.config.fishingroddurability: Offset for the maximum durability unenchanted rod a T1 Fishing Hut can use, compared to other wooden tools (59). Vanilla rods always work, but equivalents would need +6. Default value allows up to Thermal Foundation Silver  Anything below -59 will only allow vanilla rods.

Offset for the maximum durability unenchanted rod a T2 Fishing Hut can use, compared to iron tools (250). Thermal Foundation Iron requires +6. T3 huts can use unenchanted rods of any durability level, so long as they can take damage at all. Anything below -250 will only allow vanilla rods, except as allowed by T1.
minecolonies.config.auditcraftingtags.co: When loading recipes, generate audit CSV files to help debug datapacks or extra mods.
minecolonies.config.blueprintbuildmode.c: Turn this on if you're using this world for blueprint building and scanning.
minecolonies.config.maxitemsubtypescan.c: Max amount of items we scan of a given subtype before we stop.
minecolonies.config.luckyores.comment: List of ore blocks rarely found magically by Miners (see "Ore Chance"). Includes the block and its chance, separated by exclamation marks.
minecolonies.config.minimumrailstopath.c: Minimum number of consecutive rails for citizens to use them.
minecolonies.config.pathfindingmaxthread: Amount of additional threads to be used for pathfinding.
Max amount of nodes (positions) to map during pathfinding. Lowering increases performance, but might lead to pathing glitches.
minecolonies.config.enabledebuglogging.c: Should the request system show debug information in the debug.log? Useful if malfunctioning.
minecolonies.config.maximalretries.comme: The maximal amount of tries that the request system will perform for retryable requests. Higher increases server load.
The amount of ticks between retries of the request system for retryable requests. Lower increases server load.
minecolonies.config.creativeresolve.comm: Should the request system creatively resolve (if possible) when the player is required to resolve a request? This is a debugging tool and can take a very long time to resolve a request.
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseresetcom: Can Players Use the Request System Reset Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc colony requestsystem-reset command?

advancements.minecolonies.citizen_eat_fo: So this is what kind of leader you are, feeding your citizens rotten flesh? Shame, shame, shame!

advancements.minecolonies.build.miner.de: Complete building a Mine (use your build tool to place it) to get some ores and cobble for your huts
advancements.minecolonies.build.guard_to: Build a Guard Tower and hire a Guard to protect against others who may begin to notice your growing town!
advancements.minecolonies.build.farmer.d: To start food production for your citizens, build a Farm. You'll need to place the Field (scarecrow) to mark where your Farmer will farm.
Your citizens need a place to live! Build them a House - each level houses one citizen.
advancements.minecolonies.citizen.bury.d: Bury your first citizen. It's a sad day for everyone, but better than letting their grave decay away.
advancements.minecolonies.citizen.resurr: Your Undertaker resurrected a fallen citizen!

With the Courier by your side, you can utilise crafters! Build the Sawmill to start your crafting experience.

advancements.minecolonies.build.stonemas: A Stonemason can craft 3x3 recipes using stone as their main ingredient. Build one to take advantage of their skill!
advancements.minecolonies.build.smeltery: Build a Smeltery to have ore smelted for you! It's pretty efficient with a skilled worker.
advancements.minecolonies.build.stone_sm: Build a Stone Smeltery to automate the forging of stone and more for other crafters
advancements.minecolonies.build.baker.de: Your citizens need some grains in their diet. Build a Bakery so the Baker can craft baked goods for them!
advancements.minecolonies.build.blacksmi: Most citizens need some form of tool. Build the Blacksmith's Hut to allow automated crafting of tools!
advancements.minecolonies.build.barracks: You're going to need many more Guards. Build a Barracks to hire a lot more in a much smaller space!
Build the Barracks Towers inside your new Barracks. These towers are locked to the same level as the Barracks and will increase their max Guards every level!
advancements.minecolonies.build.chicken_: Build a Chicken Farmer's Hut to bring in some eggs and meat. Remember to bring the chickens to the hut.
advancements.minecolonies.build.combat_a: Battle is dangerous. Build a Combat Academy and assign a citizen to train there without the risk of losing their life!
advancements.minecolonies.build.composte: A Composter will take your leftover saplings, leaves, and like items and expose them to the elements to make fertilizer.
advancements.minecolonies.build.cook.des: Build a Restaurant to give your citizens a place to get food. The Cook will cook meats and give food to you and your citizens.

If you want more skilled labor, you'd best build a Library to educate your citizens!
advancements.minecolonies.build.shepherd: Build a Shepherd's Hut to take advantage of those poor unsuspecting sheep
advancements.minecolonies.build.sifter.d: Build a Sifter's Hut to take advantage of extra resources hiding in blocks
advancements.minecolonies.build.swine_he: Bacon - a meat eater's dream. Build a Swineherd's Hut so your citizens don't miss out.

com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.0:
The Builder is the heart of your colony. Without them, you wouldn't be able to get anything done!
 Every hut worker has to have their building built to at least level 1 before they can do anything, except the Builder. If the Builder has a hut at level 0 (no hut), they can only build one thing, their own hut.

 For your Builder to build, upgrade, reposition, or repair a hut that isn't their own, their hut must be at least the same level as the other hut. For example, the Builder's Hut must be level 3 or above to build a level 3 hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.1:
Let's cover builder restrictions:

 1. Builders (and most other workers) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 3. Diamond Tools
   lvl 4-5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Builders have a maximum range of 100 blocks for buildings for automatic assignment. If your building is outside that range, in the top right of the build options GUI (for the hut you want to be built) you can select which Builder to assign to that building.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I'm seeing an item in the required resources page that seems unobtainable or requires Silk Touch to get. What should I do?
   A 1. Things like Air, Dirt Paths, and other blocks will show up in the required resources tab from time to time. While they do show up, focus mainly on your Builder's personal request tab. They'll usually request the correct block and convert it accordingly (e.g. request dirt and then use a shovel on it).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.3:
As all workers do, the Builder levels up while working.
 At higher levels, the Builder's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.0: The House is where your citizens will live. For every level of the House, the building will house one citizen. You will need multiple houses to house everyone. The only citizens that will not live in a House are your Guards.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.1: In order to have children, a male and a female citizen must be housed together in one House. Even if you don't have room in the same hut as them, as long as there is an open bed in any House or Tavern within the colony, a child can be born. If there is an adult in another house, the child will be adopted by them, taking on the last name of that adult. If there is a hut with no adult in it, the child will get a random name.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.2: Workers have their level capped by the level of their House. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.0: The Miner is one of the production workers for your colony. They will need a pickaxe to mine stone, a shovel to mine dirt and gravel, and sometimes even an axe if they run into a mineshaft. They will also need supplies to build their own mineshafts, such as blocks, slabs, fences/walls, signs, ladders, and torches.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.1:
Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Miners unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 3. Diamond Tools
   lvl 4-5. Enchanted Tools
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How far down will my miner dig before making nodes?
   A 1. Without intervention, at level 1 they will build nodes after they hit y level 50, at level 2 they will make nodes after they hit y level 30, and at level 3 they will make nodes after they hit y level 5.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.3:
Q2. My Miner just stops working or wanders around above ground, why?
  A 2. Either something is blocking their path or they don't have the necessary materials. See page 1 for the materials they need or check the Miner's request page.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.4:
As all workers do, Miners level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Miner's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack:
The Forester is one of the production workers for your colony. Give them an axe and they'll cut down any trees around them. They'll also replant a sapling where the tree was if they have any.
 If you wish to apply restrictions on what trees they can or can't cut, take a look at the second page.
 Even cooler is the third page. Here you can tell the Forester to not replant saplings and tell them to be restricted to a certain 3D box (selected with the tool given by the third button on the page).

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Foresters unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 3. Diamond Tools
   lvl 4-5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Foresters are able to search for trees within 150 blocks of them (not their hut). While searching, they start with a 50 block range and then increase that range by 5 if they do not find a tree.

3. The definition of a "Tree" in Minecraft is pretty hazy at best. We've done our best to define a tree, but in some cases it may not be enough. Generally, we define a tree as a log and leaves next to each other. Due to this, some of your huts or decorations may be affected by the Forester. To counter this, you can place a piece of cobblestone below a log to mark it as "not a tree".

As all workers do, Foresters level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Forester's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Warehouse is part of colony management. It's where all of your excess supplies are stored. There are no workers assigned to the Warehouse, but Couriers use the Warehouse.

Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Space is limited to the number of racks in the schematic and you can not add your own. If you do, they will get destroyed when the building is updated and the Couriers will not see/use those racks. You also cannot move the racks already in the building. If you break a rack, it is no longer seen by the Couriers.

3. Now let's cover some frequently asked questions: 

 Q 1. I need more storage space that is given, how do I get more? 
 A 1. Upgrade the building. If the building is level 5, you can increase the space in each rack by buying more on page 2 of the GUI using an emerald block. This can be done 3 times.

Q 2. I want to move my Warehouse, can I do that? 
 A 2. You can, but if there is anything in the racks, the contents will spill out when the racks are removed by the Builder. If you must move the Warehouse, remove all the contents from the racks first, and watch to make sure any Couriers don't deliver items.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryma: Couriers are part of colony management. They are the transportation service of the colony and will pick up unneeded items from worker huts and drop them at the Warehouse, as well as gather needed items from the Warehouse and deliver them to workers.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 The number of stacks a Courier can carry at a time depends on their hut level. 
 Level 1: 1 Stack 
 Level 2: 2 Stacks 
 Level 3: 4 Stacks 
 Level 4: 8 Stacks 
 Level 5: unlimited stacks (that can still fit in their inventory)

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How do I change the priority of who the Couriers pick up from?
   A 1. In each hut, there is a pickup priority setting. 1 is the lowest, 10 is the highest, and there's also never (no items will ever be picked up).

 Q 2. Can I change the delivery priority?
 A 2. No, the delivery schedule is determined by the order the request is sent.

As all workers do, Couriers level up while working.
 At higher levels, a Courier's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.0:
The Cook is part of the food production of your colony. The Cook supplies all your citizens with food and will cook meat and potatoes, as well as other cooked food that only needs a furnace.
 When a citizen gets hungry, they will go to the Cook to get something to eat.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.1:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. The Cook is asking for items that are already cooked, is this normal?
   A 1. You can provide pre-cooked items for the Cook to distribute to your colonists.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.2:
As all workers do, the Cook levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Cook's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.0: The Baker is part of the food production of your colony. They will bake bread, cookies, pumpkin pie, and/or cake. On page two of the Bakery GUI, you can select which items you want them to make.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.1: The Baker cannot make any food with items that are not consumed in the making like pots and pans. These are usually from mods like Pam's.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Baker is using more items than they are producing, why?
   A 1. The Baker may be consuming some product when they get hungry. Also, while the wheat/other ingredients may not be visible, the product may still be in the process of being produced.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.3:
As all workers do, the Baker levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Baker's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.0: The Farmer is part of the food production of your colony. The Farmer grows crops for the colony. The Farmer can plant and harvest any crop that is planted in farmland, even from other mods.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.1:
Farmers unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 3. Diamond Tools
   lvl 4-5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Farmers cannot grow plants that do not use farmland, such as sugar cane, cactus, or bamboo. These are grown by the Planter instead.
 Farmers can only maintain one field per each hut level.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I want a smaller field, how do I tell my Farmer not to grow crops up to the maximum size? 
   A 1. Use the Field GUI to set the size of the field.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.3:
As all workers do, the Farmer levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Farmer's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Fisher is part of the food production of your colony. Simply put, the Fisher will fish as long as you provide them with a fishing rod and a big enough area of water.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. The Fisher needs a body of water at least seven blocks by seven blocks and at least one block deep. The hut block must be at the same level as the water and must be <= ten blocks from the water.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Fisher is catching more than just fish, why?
   A 1. The Fishermen can catch other items, same as a player can.

As all workers do, the Fisher levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Fisher's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.chickenher: The Chicken Farmer is part of the food production of your colony. The Chicken Farmer breeds, raises, and butchers chickens. They will collect eggs, feathers, and meat, as well as any drops from other mods. The Chicken Farmer will keep two chickens alive per level of their hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Chicken Farmers unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 3. Diamond Tools
   lvl 4-5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two chickens must be provided for the Chicken Farmer to start breeding and butchering.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Chicken Farmer need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two chickens to get things started. The Chicken Farmer also needs seeds to breed the chickens and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers do, the Chicken Farmer levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Chicken Farmer's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.swineherde: The Swineherd is part of the food production of your colony. The Swineherd breeds, raises, and butchers pigs. They will collect the meat, as well as any drops from other mods. The Swineherd will keep two pigs alive per level of their hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Swineherds unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 3. Diamond Tools
   lvl 4-5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two pigs must be provided for the Swineherd to start breeding and butchering.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Swineherd need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two pigs to get things started. The Swineherd also needs carrots to breed the pigs and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers do, the Swineherd levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Swineherd's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.0: The Shepherd is part of the food production of your colony. The Shepherd breeds, raises, shears, and butchers sheep. They will collect the meat and wool, as well as any drops from other mods. The Shepherd will keep two sheep alive per level of their hut. If you choose, on the second page of the GUI you can tell the Shepherd to randomly dye sheep to get colored wool.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Shepherds unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 3. Diamond Tools
   lvl 4-5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two sheep must be provided for the Shepherd to start breeding and butchering.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Shepherd need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two sheep to get things started. The Shepherd also needs wheat to breed the sheep, shears to shear the wool, and an axe to butcher the sheep.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.3:
As all workers do, the Shepherd levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Shepherd's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.0: The Cowhand is part of the food production of your colony. The Cowhand breeds, raises, and butchers cows. They will collect the meat and leather, as well as any drops from other mods. The Cowhand will keep two cows alive per level of their hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Cowhands unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 3. Diamond Tools
   lvl 4-5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two cows must be provided for the Cowhand to start breeding and butchering.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Cowhand need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two cows to get things started. The Cowhand also needs wheat to breed the cows and an axe to butcher them.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.3:
As all workers do, the Cowhand levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Cowhand's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Composter is part of the crafting line of your colony. The Composter will turn items into compost for Farmers and Florists to use.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. You must choose which items you want the Composter to use to make compost with. This is found on page two of the hut GUI. 
   Be careful using food items if you have a large colony but not many food production huts!

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I use items from other mods?
   A 1. Yes, but these must be added in the MineColonies configuration file. This is found in (your instance folder)/config/minecolonies-common.toml.

As all workers do, the Composter levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Composter's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.guardtower:
The Guard Tower is the basic hut for your military defense. Each Guard Tower employs one Guard. However, the Guard will also live in the tower, freeing up a bed for more citizens.
There are two different types of Guards, Knights and Archers. Knights use swords, while Archers use bows.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Guards unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 3. Diamond Tools
   lvl 4-5. Enchanted Tools

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Guard Tower was leveled up, but the Guard isn't asking for higher-level equipment. Why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers do, the Guard levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Guard's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracksto:
The Barracks Tower is the heart of your military defense. Each Barracks Tower employs 1 Guard per level for a total of 5. However, the Guards will also live in the tower, freeing up beds for more citizens.
There are two different types of Guards, Knights and Archers. Knights use swords, while Archers use bows.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Guards unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 3. Diamond Tools
   lvl 4-5. Enchanted Tools

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Barracks Tower was leveled up, but the Guards aren't asking for higher level equipment. Why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers do, the Guards level up while working.
 At higher levels, a Guard's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.0:
The Barracks is the heart of your military defense. Without it you wouldn't be able to build any Barracks Towers!
 Each Barracks contains four Barracks Towers, one for each level (up to level four).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Barracks only hold 1 Barracks Tower per level, and each tower can only level as high as the Barracks. So if you have a level 1 Barracks, it will only allow 1 Barracks Tower with a max level of 1. If you have a level 3 Barracks, it will allow 3 Barracks Towers with a max level of 3.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I have more than 1 Barracks?
   A 1. Yes, but the Barracks Tower levels are based on the Barracks they are attached to. So even if you have one Barracks that is level 5, if the second Barracks is only level 1, then that Barracks can only have a single level 1 tower.
The Graveyard is the resting place of your fallen citizens!

Without it, you'll still be able to manually collect fallen citizens' graves, but your colony will mourn longer.

Each Graveyard needs an Undertaker, who collects graves within the city.

During their free time, the Undertaker will get to know citizens and visit the Mystical Site, slowly attuning to the mana of the world.

If their Mana skill is high, the Undertaker has a small chance to resurrect a fallen citizen!

You can increase this chance by upgrading the Graveyard, building a Mystical Site, and completing researches in the University.

com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.alchemist: Brews potions; also gathers mistletoe and netherwart.

com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.blacksmith: Crafts tools, weapons, armour, and many other things made of metal.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.chickenherd: Keeps a watchful eye out for §mspies§r chickens.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.composter: Uses compost barrels to turn various items into compost or dirt (look up usages for the compost barrel to see more). At higher skill levels, they can work faster than you can.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.cowboy: Corrals a herd of cows (and can milk them too).
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.concretemix: Crafts concrete powder and concrete. Can't learn other recipes.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.cook: The restaurant's cook will cook various food items until they are edible.

com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.crusher: Crushes blocks into base forms. Each building can only do one of these at a time.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.dyer: Crafts dyes and anything that uses dye as a component.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.farmer: In addition to tending fields, the farmer can craft things with hay, seeds, or dirt.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.fisherman: Catches fish and other items as usual, plus some bonus items at higher levels.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.fletcher: Crafts arrows and leather armor. Also plain items made from wool and string.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.glassblower: Smelts glass itself, plus crafts things made from glass as well.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.lumberjack: While they mostly just chop trees, they will also strip and modify logs if required.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.mechanic: Crafts mechanisms or other things based on redstone, glowstone, pearls, blaze, etc.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.planter: Grows cane and bamboo, and crafts things made with them too.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.rabbitherde: Attempts to keep the rabbit population in check.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.sawmill: Crafts most things that are made primarily from wood.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.sifter: Extracts more valuable resources from common ones, but rarely. The mesh lasts a while, but can eventually break.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.smelter: Breaks ore blocks with fortune (based on level), and smelts as needed.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.stonemason: Crafts things made from various kinds of stone.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.stonesmelte: Smelts various kinds of stone and terracotta.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.swineherder: Just happy with pigs in mud.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.netherworke: Makes periodic trips to the nether to retrieve materials, but it's a very dangerous job, and requires significant supplies.

com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.jmwarr: Hi, I'm Luz! Child of the Human Realm and student of the Demon Realm! I've come in search far and wide for a place to inspire and provide my magical skills! Say, do you know how I got here? And have you seen any portal doors with a giant eye?
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.doggus: Doggus, a passionate builder with a heart torn between creativity and perfectionism, stands at the precipice of their aspirations, yearning to construct masterpieces while battling inner doubts.
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.chewba: After losing my village, I am travelling from city to city offering my services as a knight to protect others so that they do not suffer the same fate as my village.
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.moobie: Just a simple bloke from the deep south looking for somewhere to build
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.cammy: I am an elven brewmaster from the fallen Silverleaf Realm, roaming MineColonies offering exotic brews, seeking allies to reclaim his homeland's lost magic and glory
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.duran: Hi! I'm not sure how I got here.....BUT HECC YOU IM STAYIN!
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.sheize: Hi there! I'm an explorer who goes by the name Reizar. There is something interesting about this place, and I'd like to be a part of it.
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.androm: We have come on our journey to visit all the corners of the universe. However, this seems like a nice place to rest for a couple moments. Prepared to provide research related services in payment for exotic minerals.
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.potato: I used to be just Jack then I made a bet with the Devil.. What was his name?.. 'Ray', I think. Anyways, being a cactus has.. interrupted my relationships. I've been wandering these lands for as long as I can remember. Then finally, I saw your pathetic village and thought 'hmm.. someone that lame could definitely use my help!'
com.minecolonies.coremod.recruit.message: %s has decided to stay in your colony as a citizen! They quickly switched out of their travellers gear into some new clothes to fit in!

block.minecolonies.mediumquarry.name: Medium Quarry
block.minecolonies.largequarry.name: Large Quarry
com.minecolonies.coremod.quarrier.noquar: Please assign me to a quarry so that I can start working!

minecolonies:deliveryman.job.desc: Delivers requested items and blocks to players and colonists.
minecolonies:miner.job.desc: Mines out a shaft system under the colony, gathering blocks and ores. Can be a dangerous job.
minecolonies:quarrier.job.desc: Requires a Quarry building to mine a large hole. Safe job, but mostly returns common resources.
minecolonies:lumberjack.job.desc: Cuts down trees and replants them based on the configured specifications.
minecolonies:farmer.job.desc: Farms a large variety of crops at up 5 fields.
minecolonies:undertaker.job.desc: Digs up citizens graves to get their items, with a chance to resurrect them.
minecolonies:fisherman.job.desc: Spends most of the time fishing at a pond, river or lake.
minecolonies:baker.job.desc: Handles all wheat-based recipes. Knows some special bread recipes.
minecolonies:cook.job.desc: Handles most of the cooking and hands out food to colonists.
minecolonies:shepherd.job.desc: Shears sheep and controls the size of the flock.
minecolonies:cowboy.job.desc: Milks and breeds cows to get milk, leather, and raw beef.
minecolonies:chickenherder.job.desc: Gathers eggs, feathers, and other chicken products.
minecolonies:ranger.job.desc: Distance fighter, deals high damage, but has low survival chance in close combat.
minecolonies:knight.job.desc: Close-quarter fighter. High resilience, low damage output.
minecolonies:composter.job.desc: Composts a lot of the colony waste products
minecolonies:student.job.desc: Reads books to increase their intelligence. High intelligence allows learning other skills faster.
minecolonies:sawmill.job.desc: Provides the colony with most wood based items.
minecolonies:blacksmith.job.desc: Provides the colony with most tools, armor, and weapons.
minecolonies:stonesmeltery.job.desc: Provides the stone variants that require smelting and charcoal
minecolonies:crusher.job.desc: Crushes cobble to gravel, gravel to sand, and sand to clay.
minecolonies:sifter.job.desc: Sifts through a variety of materials to find goodies.
minecolonies:florist.job.desc: Plants a large variety of flowers for the colony.
minecolonies:enchanter.job.desc: Gathers mana by observing others. Enchants colonist tools and creates enchanting books.
minecolonies:researcher.job.desc: Researches the topics the player selects.
minecolonies:healer.job.desc: Heals wounded entities and provides cures for the sick.
minecolonies:pupil.job.desc: Sits around and learns from the material provided by the teacher.
minecolonies:teacher.job.desc: Sits with the kids and provides material.
minecolonies:dyer.job.desc: Handles most of the dyeing that is required in the colony.
minecolonies:mechanic.job.desc: Handles redstone recipes and things other workers can't handle.
minecolonies:fletcher.job.desc: Handles leather, string and wool based recipes.
minecolonies:planter.job.desc: Provides sugar cane, cactus, and bamboo to the colony.
minecolonies:concretemixer.job.desc: Creates concrete powder and actual concrete.
minecolonies:cookassistant.job.desc: Handles food-based recipes the main cook can't handle.
minecolonies:smelter.job.desc: Breaks ore blocks into raw ore and smelts raw ores into ingots.
minecolonies:druid.job.desc: Support type unit. Buffs friendlies and nerfs enemies.
minecolonies:netherworker.job.desc: Wanders into the Nether to gather a wide range of materials. A very dangerous job!.
minecolonies:alchemist.job.desc: Brews Potions, plants Netherwart and harvests Mistletoes

com.minecolonies.core.settlementcovenant: In the year %d after creeper, we formally lay down the foundations of a new settlement henceforth called:
We pledge to steward the land with care, ensuring the safety, prosperity, and wellbeing of all who call it home.
Furthermore, we solemnly commit to fostering constructive relations with the neighboring settlement of %s, located no more than %s blocks from here.
Furthermore, we solemnly commit to fostering constructive relations with potential neighboring settlements.
May this covenant stand as a testament to our shared dedication to building a better future for ourselves and generations to come.
com.minecolonies.core.founding.toocloset: We can't settle here. This place is too close to the world spawn and claimed by the Herobrine family. Let's journey further out, by at least another %d blocks.
com.minecolonies.core.founding.toofarfro: We can't settle out here. This place is too far from the usual trade routes. Let's turn back and retreat by at least %d blocks.
com.minecolonies.core.founding.toocloset: We can't settle here. This spot is already claimed by a closeby colony. Let's respectfully give them their space and seek out new horizons, at least %d blocks from here.
Are you sure you wish to proceed? This action cannot be undone and will leave behind a ghost town!
com.minecolonies.core.gui.colony.abandon: Are you sure you wish to proceed? This action cannot be undone and you may not be able to alter certain settings in the old colony anymore!

⚠ Warning ⚠ 

 You are already administering a settlement at 
 [%d %d %d] called %s. 

 If you wish to establish another settlement here, you have two options: 

 - Either destroy the existing settlement entirely, leaving behind a ghost town. 

 - Or step down from your position as mayor and retain a role as an officer within the old colony.
⚠ Warning ⚠ 

 You are already administering a settlement at

com.minecolonies.core.gui.colony.reactiv: Are you, valiant traveler, brave enough to pick up where we failed and rebuild %s to its former glory?
com.minecolonies.core.gui.reactivate.mes: This once thrived as a %s. With careful attention and the skilled hands of a builder, you can breathe new life into this structure, enabling citizens to once again call it home. Assign a builder to restore it to its former glory, reactivating its purpose and revitalizing the community.

This building once hummed with the activity of a %s. By initiating its reactivation, you'll open doors for citizens to resume their work here. Entrust a skilled builder with its repair, restoring it to its former functionality and igniting productivity once more.
com.minecolonies.coremod.building.missin: This building seems to belong to a long abandoned colony, try to locate the townhall to find out what happened here.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.colony: News spreads swiftly of the newly founded settlement. Before long, pioneers from distant lands will flock to join the ranks of your burgeoning colony.

Word of a courageous adventurer dedicated to restoring the glory of %s swiftly traverses the land. Eager settlers and former residents alike are drawn to your townhall, inspired by the opportunity to contribute their skills and efforts to this noble endeavor.
This building was abandoned together with this colony a long time ago. You can reactivate this building to allow citizens to live or work here. Let a builder repair it to restore it to its initial state.
com.minecolonies.core.gui.supplies.guide:
Use these supplies to assemble a %s to serve as a foundation for your own colony. Within it, aside from §2ample resources§r, you shall find
a salvaged §2townhall block§r and §2build tool§r to lay the groundworks of the new colony. Founding a colony demands resilience; beyond the basic necessities of shelter, sustenance, and healing, lies the imperative to fortify against the looming threats of piracy and barbarism. Yet, should you endure these trials, the potential for growth knows no bounds. From artisans to scholars, miners to alchemists, your settlement holds the promise of evolving into a §2self-sustaining bastion of prosperity and knowledge§r.

minecolonies.quests.general.alchemy.obj0: I just discovered a new alchemical process but I need some materials to test it out. Do you think you could help me with that?
Splendid! Well, I require the flesh of three zombies!
I suddenly don't feel like being part of this.
I'm sorry, I can't help right now.
I won't be able to help you with that.
minecolonies.quests.general.alchemy.obj1: *Laughs Maniacally* I have done it. I have done it! I have created a potion of eternal life! Here try it!
minecolonies.quests.general.alchemy.obj2: The flesh you delivered me seemed a bit cold. I feel I require warm zombie flesh. Three again please
Uhhh, I get to kill some more zombies. Sure!
I suddenly don't feel like being part of this anymore.
minecolonies.quests.general.alchemy.obj5: Splendid! This looks just perfect! But I'm afraid I need something new! Fetch me 2 fresh spider eyes.
minecolonies.quests.general.alchemy.obj7: Hehehehehe! Perfect! Now I just need something to fuel the reaction. Gun powder would be perfect!
I have no concern. No problem!
One creeper for the gun powder or stealing some from the guards? No problem!
This sounds concerning. I want out!
minecolonies.quests.general.alchemy.obj9: Splendid! Let me mix them together real quick!
minecolonies.quests.general.cookies.obj0: Hi, Thank you for hiring me as a baker! I always wanted to be a baker! Let's make some cookies for young ones!
I need two wheat and one coco bean!
They're not my kids, why should I do it?
I'm sorry, I can't help right now.
I won't be able to help you with that.
minecolonies.quests.general.cookies.obj3: Thank you. I'll get right on this!
minecolonies.quests.general.cookies.obj4: Here you are. Please take those 8 cookies and deliver them to $1! You can find the kid with the help of the quest log.
minecolonies.quests.general.cookies.obj5: Hi! The baker told me you got cookies for me!
Yes, But I ate them all!
You are a so mean! I will never forget this!
Yes, I have them here! Give me a second!
minecolonies.quests.general.cookies.obj7: Please make sure to share them with your friends!
Suuuure! I found this shiny thing on the floor. Here you can have it!
Thank you! I found this shiny thing on the floor. Here you can have it!
Thank you! I found this shiny thing on the floor. Here you can have it!
minecolonies.quests.general.hungrycourie: Hey there, could I ask you a favour?
I'm starving and I forgot my lunch at home. Could you bring me some food?
What kind of food do you want?
A baked potato would just hit the spot!
Got it. I'll be right back.
I'm sorry, I don't have any food on me.
Ah, too bad. I guess I'll just have to make do until I get home.
I'll see if I can find something for you later.
Sorry, I'm in a rush right now!
Oh, this was great! Thanks a lot!
minecolonies.quests.general.thezombiemen: We have a problem. The Zombies in the nearby forest are causing trouble. Can you help us take care of them?
Sure, I'll do what I can.
Thank you! We need you to kill 2 Zombies. We'll reward you for your efforts.
I'm sorry, I can't help right now.
You did it! We're safe for now. Here's your reward.
We have a problem. The Zombies in the nearby forest are causing trouble. Can you help us take care of them?
Sure, I'll do what I can.
Thank you! We need you to kill 10 Zombies. We'll reward you for your efforts.
I'm sorry, I can't help right now.
You did it! We're safe for now. Here's your reward.
minecolonies.quests.guides.buildergoggle: Hey there! Can I ask you for a favor? I lost my glasses the other day and I can't see very well without them. Do you think you could get me a new pair of builders goggles?
Of course, I'll see what I can do!
Sorry, I don't have time to help you right now.
I already know all about the builder goggles. You'll be fine without them!
Ah, you found my glasses! Thank you so much. I can finally see clearly what I'm building again. You should try them out sometime, they're pretty neat.
minecolonies.quests.guides.clipboard.obj: Hey there! Have you heard of the clipboard? It's a tool that can help you keep track of all the requests in our colony. If you could bring me one, I would be forever grateful!
Sure, I'll see what I can do!
Sorry, I can't help you right now.
I already know what it does!

Great, you found a clipboard! To use it, simply shift-right click it on any hut block. This will give you an overview of all the requests in the colony. It's super handy, and I am so grateful that you were able to get one for me. Thank you!
minecolonies.quests.guides.rallybanner.o: Lately, we've been seeing a lot of skeletons wandering around at night. If you could help us out by taking care of ten of them, we'd be very grateful!
No problem, I'll take care of it!
Sorry, I'm too busy right now.
Sorry, I don't think I can help you with that.
Thank you for taking care of those skeletons! You're very brave. Listen, I have something that might help us out. It's called a rallying banner. Could you bring it to me?
Sorry, I don't think I can help you with that.
A rallying banner? Sounds interesting. I'll go find it.

Thanks for bringing me the rallying banner! To use it, simply shift-right click it on any hut block. This will allow you to assign guards to it, and you can manage it by right clicking in the air. It's a great tool for keeping the colony safe!
Great, I'll make sure to put it to good use!
minecolonies.quests.guides.resourcescrol: Hello there! Have you heard about the Resource Scroll? It's a powerful tool that can help you gather resources more efficiently. I really need one, but I don't have the time to go and find it myself. Would you be willing to bring one to me?
Sure, I can try to find one for you!
I'm sorry, I don't have the time right now.
I already know what it does!

Thank you so much for bringing me the Resource Scroll! You know, all you have to do is shift-right-click it on the hut block to activate it. It will help you gather resources more quickly and efficiently. I hope you find it as useful as I do!
Thanks for the tip, I'll be sure to use it!
minecolonies.quests.romance.aromanticges: Hello there, could I ask you to help me with something?
I want to give a poppy to $1, but I'm too shy to do it myself. Can you deliver it for me?
Of course, I'll be happy to help.
I'm sorry, but I can't do that for you.
Oh, that's too bad. I guess I'll have to try to do it myself.
I'm sorry, I don't have time right now.
Oh, this is beautiful! Thank you so much! Who is it from?
Oh, I see! I'll be sure to thank them. Here, take this as a token of my gratitude.
Hey, thank you so much for delivering that poppy to me earlier. It really made my day. I was wondering if I could ask you for another favour?
Of course, what do you need?
I have a friend who is feeling a bit down and I want to cheer them up. Could you bring $1 this gift for me?
Sure, I'll be happy to help.
I'm sorry, but I'm a bit busy right now.
Oh, that's too bad. Maybe another time then.
Sure, I'll keep it in mind.
I'm sorry, but I can't help you right now.
Oh, hello! $0 told me to bring you a gift to cheer you up.
How kind of them! Thank you so much!
Thank you so much for delivering that gift. You're a true friend.
No problem, glad I could help.
minecolonies.quests.template.questtempla: Could you bring me an Apple? I'm really hungry!
Sorry, I don't have time right now!
We don't have any apples right now!
Could I bring you a baked potato?
I don't have time right now!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.builder.obj: Hey there! I saw you got your builder hut placed. Nice! Are you ready for the next step?
Yes sure!
Nice, so let's get this builder hut built then. Right click the builder hut block, go into 'Build Options' and click 'Build Building'
Already done!
On it!

No Problem! To see what the builder requires for this building you can right click the hut and select the 'Required Resources' tab which is the second tab from the top on the left. You can drop off items there directly or through the inventory available through the inventory button in the bottom middle of the main page or by shift right clicking the block.
Okay thanks!
Great! Come back to me once you checked that out!
Understood, be right back!
I already finished building the hut!
Oh nice, then we are already done here and I will have more information on the next steps soon!
Awesome!
Not right now. I will come back to you later!
Welcome back, were you able to start the build request?
No, I forgot what I had to do!
No Problem! Right click the builder hut block, go into 'Build Options' and click 'Build Building'
Thanks! Will try again!
Yes, done, what's next?

Nice! To see what the builder requires for this building you can right click the hut and select the 'Required Resources' tab which is the second tab from the top on the left. You can drop off items there directly or through the inventory by shift right clicking on the block.
Okay thanks!
Great! Come back to me once you checked that out!
Understood, be right back!
I already finished building the hut!
Oh nice, then we are already done here and I will have more information on the next steps soon!

No Problem! To see what the builder requires for this building you can right click the hut and select the 'Required Resources' tab which is the second tab from the top on the left. You can drop off items there directly or through the inventory available through the inventory button in the bottom middle of the main page or by shift right clicking the block.
Okay thanks!
Great! Come back to me once you checked that out!
Understood, be right back!

Awesome! Your builder might also need some tools to prepare the building area. You can supervise your builders immediate needs by right clicking them and selecting the 'Open Requests' tab which is the second from the top on the left. You can fulfill the request right there or through their inventory by shift right clicking them.
Oh nice, good to know!
Great! Come back to me once the builder finished building.
On it!
I already finished building the hut!
Oh nice, then we are already done here and I will have more information on the next steps soon!

Congratulations. You built the first building of your colony! Come back to me in a bit and I will let you know the next steps! Here, have some cobblestone as a reward!
Thank you!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.builder2.ob: I see your colony is growing nicely. How about we upgrade your builders hut to take your colony to the next level?

Upgrading buildings yields many benefits. Aside from your citizens leveling up faster they may also use higher tool tiers. You can upgrade the building through the build options after right clicking the hut block.
Excellent. I'll leave you be for now then. Make sure to check on your quest log regularly.
Not right now. I will come back to you later!
Excellent. I'll leave you be for now then. Make sure to check on your quest log regularly.
Awesome! This will now also allow you to upgrade all kinds of other buildings. Make sure to regularly check the quest log about future tasks!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.farm.obj0: Hello there! We are producing some wood, but you might have already noticed that us citizens also require food, so we should try to build a farm so that the colony can also be self sufficient on food.
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.farm.obj0.a: Nice, so as usual we start by crafting the farm hut block. In the crafting bench, surround a wooden or stone hoe with planks and put the Build Tool in the top. Come back to me once you've done that!'
Alrighty then! Then it's time to place the Farm with the Build Tool, click build and provide your builder with the necessary items like the last time and come back once it is built!
I already set up the farm!
Oh nice, then we are already done here and I will have more information on the next steps soon!
Not right now. I will come back to you later!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.farm.obj1: Welcome back, were you able to craft the Farm hut block?
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.farm.obj1.a: A great leap forward often requires taking two steps back! In the crafting bench, surround a wooden or stone hoe with planks and put the Build Tool in the top.
Alright! I'll get back to it!
Alrighty then! Then it's time to place the Farm with the Build Tool, click build and provide your builder with the necessary items like the last time and come back once it is built!
Not yet, I will get to it later!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.farm.obj3: Okay great. But before your farmer can start working they need a field. To craft it in the crafting bench put a pumpkin or hay bale at the top, leather in the middle and then sticks to the right and left and below the the leather.
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.farm.obj3.a: I already set up the field!
Oh nice, then we are already done here and I will have more information on the next steps soon!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.farm.obj4: Welcome back, were you able to craft the Field block?

Alright! I'll get back to it!

Great! You can either manually place the field by right clicking the block close to the farm in some open space. Or let the Builder build a pre-made field from the build tool menu. Either way, make sure there is water for the field. Come back to me once either of that is done!
Not yet, I will get to it later!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.farm.obj6: Now all that is missing is setting a crop type for your farmer to plant by right clicking the field block and selecting a type of crop. Here have some seeds, I'll let you know about the next steps soon!

Neat, soon your colony will be mostly autonomous on wood. Make sure to check in on your forester now and then to make sure they got the tools they need and you can grow some different types of trees around the hut to get different types of logs, Come back in a bit and I'll help you with the next steps! Here, have some torches, those will sure come in handy!
See you in a bit!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.housing.obj: Now that all your 4 basic citizens have a job, it's time to think about expanding the colony to get more citizens. From this point on, you will need open housing space to get more citizens either by hiring visitors from the tavern or waiting for your citizens to have children!
I'm all ears!

Residences offer one housing spot per building level. So, let's start by crafting 4 Residence hut blocks. In the crafting bench, surround a torch with planks and put the Build Tool in the top. Come back to me once you've done that!'
On it!
Already done!
Perfect! Then it's time to place the 4 Residences with the Build Tool, click build and provide your Builder with the necessary items like the last time and come back once all 4 are built!
Consider it done!
Not right now. I will come back to you later!
Already done!
Oh nice, then we are done here and I will have more information on the next steps soon!

Awesome! Now you should have some space to hire some visitors from the tavern (by right clicking and providing the items they require) or at least have space for your citizens to have some children. Here, have some wool, it will sure come in handy. Will contact you in a bit again!
See you in a bit!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.housing2.ob: Now that you got a level 2 builder the next logical step is upgrading your residences. Residences house 1 citizen per housing level up to five citizens at level five.
Sounds exciting! What do you want me to do?.
Upgrade two of your residences to level 2 and come back to me later then!
Excellent. I'll leave you be for now then. Make sure to check on your quest log regularly.
Not right now. I will come back to you later!
Excellent. I'll leave you be for now then. Make sure to check on your quest log regularly.

Amazing! This is the best way to attract new citizens to your colony! Not only that! Citizens are also considerably happier in higher residence tiers! Here I found these racks earlier. I'm sure they will come in handy!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.military.gu: Building Defences
I'm still not feeling very safe. Some might argue that the strongest defense is a swift and decisive offense. How about you build some guard towers?
Alright, on it!
Nice, so as usual we start by crafting the Guard Tower block. In the crafting bench, surround a bow with planks and put the Build Tool in the top. Come back to me once you've done that!'
On it!
Already done!
Alrighty then! Then it's time to place both Guard Towers with the Build Tool, click build and provide your Builder with the necessary items like the last time and come back once they are built!
Consider it done!
Not right now. I will come back to you later!

Oh nice, then we are done here and I will have more information on the next steps soon!

Awesome, I feel much safer already. Guards actually live in their guard towers and don't need housing spots. So just make sure they have armor and weapons and they will serve you well. Come back in a bit and I'll help you with the next steps!
See you in a bit!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.military.to: Hello! I see your colony is growing. However, it is quite dangerous around here. How about you light the area up a little bit to avoid monsters prying on your citizens?
Not right now. I will come back to you later!
Great, thanks! This should definitely help a bit. Here, I found those, I'm sure they will come in handy!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.military.zo: Hi, there seem to be a lot of dangerous mobs around here! Would you mind killing some zombies to make us feel more at ease?
Not right now. I will come back to you later!
Great, thanks! I feel more at ease already. Here, have some leather armor!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.mine.obj0: Hello there! We should be producing enough food for now. Just make sure your colonist stay fed by leaving food in their inventories. The next step is then to get a Mine up and running!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.mine.obj0.a: So, as usual we start by crafting the Mine hut block. In the crafting bench, surround a wooden or stone pickaxe with planks and put the Build Tool in the top. Come back to me once you've done that!'
Alrighty then! Then it's time to place the Mine with the Build Tool, click build and provide your Builder with the necessary items like the last time and come back once it is built!
Not right now. I will come back to you later!

minecolonies.quests.tutorial.mine.obj3: Neat, soon your miner will start bringing in all kinds of stones and ores, just make sure that you provide them the necessary tools and materials. The miner will first dig down and build a shaft structure for which they will require some material. Later they will also expand horizontally.
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.mine.obj3.a: Come back in a bit and I'll help you with the next steps! Here, have some ladders, the miner will need them soon!
While we are getting food from the farm, you still have to manually feed the citizens when they are hungry. How about we build a restaurant so that is taken care of automatically?
Sounds great!!

The cook in the restaurant will not only cook food for you in the furnace automatically, but they will also hand out food to citizens that are hungry. You know the drill, craft the restaurant hut block in a crafting bench. This time surround an apple with planks and the build tool at the top.'
On it!
Already done!
Alrighty then! Then it's time to place the Restaurant with the Build Tool, click build and provide your Builder with the necessary items like the last time and come back once it is built!
Consider it done!
Not right now. I will come back to you later!
Already done!
Oh nice, then we are done here and I will have more information on the next steps soon!
Nice!
Welcome back, were you able to craft the Restaurant hut block?
No, I forgot the recipe!
No problem! In the crafting bench, surround an apple with planks and put the Build Tool in the top.
Alright! I'll get back to it!

Alrighty then! Then it's time to place the Restaurant with the Build Tool, click build and provide your Builder with the necessary items like the last time and come back once it is built!

See you in a bit!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.tavern.obj0: Hi there! Your builder is looking neat! How about we let them build a Tavern so that your citizens don't have to sleep outside and are safe at night?

Alrighty then! Then it's time to place the Tavern with the Build Tool, click build and provide your Builder with the necessary items like the last time and come back once it is built!

minecolonies.quests.tutorial.tavern.obj3: Amazing, you are now providing housing for all your citizens. The Tavern provides four housing slots but you can have at most one Tavern per colony. Come back a bit later and I will let you know the next steps! Here, have some baked potatoes as a reward to help keep the citizens fed!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.warehouse.o: Hi! I'm sure your feet are hurting by now because you are manually fulfilling all the citizens needs! I got good news! You can automate most of this with the help of a warehouse and courier!
Tell me more about it!

Let's start by crafting a warehouse block by surrounding a chest with planks and the build tool in the top slot and a courier hut by surrounding a set of chain boots with planks and the build tool in the top slot.
On it!
Already got a warehouse and courier!
Excellent. I'll leave you be for now then. Make sure to check on your quest log regularly.
Noted!
Not right now. I will come back to you later!

Excellent. I'll leave you be for now then. Make sure to check on your quest log regularly.

Craft a warehouse block by surrounding a chest with planks and the build tool in the top slot and a courier hut by surrounding a set of chain boots with planks and the build tool in the top slot.
On it!

That was fast! Next place the buildings with the help of the build tool, click build and supply your builder with the materials. I advise you to place the warehouse somewhat centrally in your colony for easy access. The courier hut location is inconsequential on the other hand.
Noted!

Neat! The food your farmer produces will now automatically reach the restaurant through the warehouse. Here, have a set of tools you can drop off in the warehouse to be delivered to your citizens on demand.
Thank you. Bye!
minecolonies.quests.tutorial.welcome.obj: Hello there! I just arrived here and wondered if you wish any guidance setting up the colony?
Yes please!

So let's start by picking a style for your colony first! You can pick a unique style for your colony by going to your Town Hall and right clicking the block. This is the main page. Now, on the right hand side, click the button next to 'Colony Pack' to select your colony style.
Alright! Let me get to it!
I already picked a style!

Okay great. Next, I suggest you to browse the Build Tool to find different buildings you can build. With the Build Tool in your hand, right click on the ground, try to locate the Builder's Hut, then come back to me!
Okay, let me do that!
Okay, I'll do that again!
Yes, but not now. I will come back to you later!
I'm a Colony Master! You underestimate my power!
Hi! Did you choose a colony style already?
No, I forgot what I had to do!

No Problem! You can pick a unique style for your colony by going to your Town Hall and right clicking the block. This is the main page. Now, on the right hand side, click the button next to 'Colony Pack' to select your colony style.
Thanks! Let me check again!
Yes, all done, what is next?
Okay great. Next, I suggest you browse the Build Tool a little bit. With the Build Tool in your hand, right click on the ground, try to locate the Builder's Hut, then come back to me!
Okay, let me do that!
Okay, I'll do that again!
Not yet, I will get to it later!
Welcome back! Were you able to navigate the Build Tool?
Yes; mission accomplished!

Awesome! Then, before placing it, we first have to craft a Builder's Hut hut block. Just surround a door with planks in the crafting table and put the Build Tool in the middle top slot. Come back to me after you have crafted the hut block!
Alright! Let me get to it!
No, what did I have to do again?
Skill is the child of patience. Browse the Build Tool a little bit. With the Build Tool in your hand, right click on the ground, try to locate the Builder's Hut, then come back to me!
Sure! I'll try!
Not yet, but I will come back to you later!
Welcome back! Did you craft the hut block already?
No, I forgot the recipe!
A great leap forward often requires taking two steps back! Just surround a door with planks in the crafting table and put the Build Tool in the top slot.
Alright! Let me get to it!

Perfect! The next step is placing it with the help of the Build Tool. Right click the Build Tool on the ground. Navigate to the Builder's Hut (typically in the fundamentals category) and click on Builder's Hut. Then, you can select a level to preview and in some cases also different alternatives. Use the arrow buttons to adjust the position, rotation, and mirroring. Finally, click the checkmark to place it.
